availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lexington & Frankfort and Louisville & Frankfort railroad lines consolidated in 1857 to create Louisville, Frankfort, and Lexington Railroad line.

ab.bibl: John E. Kelber eds., Encyclopedia of Louisville (Lexington, KY: The University Press of Kentucky, 2001), 549. J.H. Battle, Kiffin, G.C., Perrin, W.H., Kentucky: History of the State, Embracing A Concise Account of the Origin and Development of the Virginia Colony; Its Expansion Westward, and the Settlement of the Frontier Beyond the Alleghenies; The Erection of Kentucky As An Independent State, and Its Subsequent Development, 7th edition (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battery and Company, 1887), 524-526
